intro: Hiptage sumatrsma, commonly known as the Sumatran hiptage, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
